The Xbox Game Pass quest system is a fantastic way to stay engaged with the games you're playing, and it's a great way to discover new games and earn rewards.

Regarding Sea of Thieves, I'm happy to report that the game is still actively being supported by Rare, the developers. They have a strong commitment to updating the game with new content, features, and events on a regular basis.

In fact, Rare has a roadmap for Sea of Thieves that outlines their plans for future updates and expansions. They typically release a new season of content every few months, which includes new activities, quests, and cosmetic items.

Some of the recent updates have added new features like the "Heart of Fire" questline, which introduced a new storyline and gameplay mechanics, as well as the "Legends of the Sea" update, which added new cosmetic items and a new type of ship.

Rare is also working on a major update called "Season 3", which is expected to arrive soon. While details are scarce, it's rumored to include new features like a revamped UI, improved ship customization, and new gameplay mechanics.

The Sea of Thieves community is very active, and Rare is always listening to feedback and suggestions from players. So, if you have any ideas or requests, be sure to share them on the game's forums or social media channels!

Overall, I think Sea of Thieves is in a great place right now, and I'm excited to see what the future holds for the game.
